Changing File Encodings in Visual Merge

By default, Visual Merge assumes that the text files used in the three-way-merge and the resulting file all have the same encoding as the default code page for the operating system. When the files have different encodings, comparing them is difficult, if not impossible, until you specify the correct encoding for each file.

To change the encoding for a file used by or created by Visual Merge (Windows client):

  1. From the Visual Merge window, select Edit > Encoding from the menu. The File Encoding dialog appears.

  2. Select the option button for a file with incorrect encoding.

  3. Select the correct encoding from the Encoding for selected file list box.

  4. Click OK.

  5. Repeat steps 2–4 for other files with the wrong encoding.

  6. Click OK.

Note: File encodings can be changed in the Cross-Platform client though the Personal Options dialogs.
